body:
Copy-pasting a canned review comment I have:

```
// This is a code comment.  It spans a few lines, so it's
// wrapped at 80 chars.
// This is the next line.  Is it in a separate paragraph?
```

This is a pet peeve of mine. If you have a new paragraph, separate it with a newline. Otherwise, flow the two lines into one paragraph.

There are two reasons I don't like this half-paragraph break:

It feels wishy-washy, and it's not clear what it should mean. I know what a paragraph break means, but is this something weaker than that?

It can only exist when last line of the first half-paragraph is sufficiently short. That is, if the second line in the example above becomes long enough, then the half-paragraph break disappears. It seems to me that it's not desirable to have punctuation that may or may not exist, depending on the length of the line above.

This is just my opinion and not part of the style rules, so if you think I'm a crank, feel free to ignore me.
body_html:
Copy-pasting a canned review comment I have:

// This is a code comment.  It spans a few lines, so it's
// wrapped at 80 chars.
// This is the next line.  Is it in a separate paragraph?

This is a pet peeve of mine. If you have a new paragraph, separate it with a newline. Otherwise, flow the two lines into one paragraph.

There are two reasons I don't like this half-paragraph break:

It feels wishy-washy, and it's not clear what it should mean. I know what a paragraph break means, but is this something weaker than that?

It can only exist when last line of the first half-paragraph is sufficiently short. That is, if the second line in the example above becomes long enough, then the half-paragraph break disappears. It seems to me that it's not desirable to have punctuation that may or may not exist, depending on the length of the line above.

This is just my opinion and not part of the style rules, so if you think I'm a crank, feel free to ignore me.
